summary: This is an email chain from July 5, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It details plans for his arrest upon arrival at Teterboro airport from Paris, the execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and coordination with the FBI and CBP.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Target of arrest and search warrant
persons.context: The subject of the planned arrest operation; scheduled to fly from Paris to Teterboro airport, where agents plan to arrest him upon arrival.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the detailed email outlining the arrest plan for Epstein, coordination with FBI and CBP, and the search warrant execution.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is planning and coordinating the law enforcement operation to arrest Epstein and search his residence.

events.title: Planned Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro
events.description: Law enforcement agents plan to arrest Jeffrey Epstein upon his arrival at Teterboro airport from Paris, coordinating with CBP to hold him.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant at Epstein's NYC Residence
events.description: Agents plan to execute a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence immediately following his arrest on Saturday night.

events.title: Expected Court Presentment
events.description: Given the arrest timing on a Saturday, the expectation is for Epstein to be presented in court on Monday.

keyFacts: On July 5, 2019, SDNY prosecutors were actively planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein for the following day.
Epstein was scheduled to fly from Paris to Teterboro airport, landing around 5:30 PM on July 6, 2019.
The plan involved FBI agents coordinating with Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to arrest Epstein immediately upon arrival.
A search warrant for Epstein's New York City residence was to be executed immediately after his arrest on Saturday night.
The email indicates close, real-time coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, the FBI, and CBP in the lead-up to Epstein's arrest.
